**Note 2:** Physician statement of Shimada Classification can be used to code this data item when no other information is available. 

**Note 3:** The Shimada Classification is a biologically relevant classification based on morphologic features of neuroblastic tumors which has prognostic indications. It is based on the following criteria
* Quantity of Schwannian stromal development
* Grade of tumor differentiation
* Mitosis-kayorrhexis index (MKI)
* Presence of nodules
* Age

**Note 4:** Record “favorable,” or “unfavorable” based on the pathology report.
